talk0000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Sav'otta! <sp:5:0:0>Mm-hmm, that was a perfect
"v'o," if I do say so myself!
talk0030:
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0900>Captain! Not so loud! You're going to give the
Gerudo a bad impression of us!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0001:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Sav'aaq! Mm-hmm, that was a perfect
"v'a," if I do say so myself!
talk0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Sav'saaba! Mm-hmm, that was a perfect
"v'sa," if I do say so myself!
talk0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, I don't think I've seen you around
here before. Good on you for saying hello.

Who are we? We're the first men who will
officially do business with the Gerudo—
the <clr:0000>Voe Caravan Squad<clr:ffff>!
If you, too, want to go to <clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>,
you would do well to make friends
with us!
talk0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>*ahem* Anyway, the Gerudo have a <clr:0000>law
forbidding males<clr:ffff> from entering their town.

Keeping us shut out only makes us
all the more curious though! I mean,
that's just common sense!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>We were hoping to raise the <clr:0000>Voe Caravan
Squad<clr:ffff>'s likability by gallantly rescuing the
Gerudo ladies from the sand shroud...
But the sand shroud doesn't just block
our vision, it confuses our compasses too.
We got lost in about five seconds.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>In the end, it was the Gerudo ladies who
ended up gallantly rescuing us...

Still, maybe if we prove our muster as
gate guards, Gerudo Town will make an
exception and welcome us as heroes!
talk0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Don't tell me, young man!


You want to join us—the first men who will
officially do business with the Gerudo—
in the <clr:0000>Voe Caravan Squad<clr:ffff>?
Well, too bad. United for years by our
love of Gerudo Town, our squad has
been together through thick and thin!
So when those gates finally open, it'll be
just the three of us striding together into
<clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>!
talk0023:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We're a group of merchants and friends
who have long dreamed of doing business
in <clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Oh, and "voe" is the Gerudo word for
"man." Voe's the word to know!

If you don't understand at least one word
in their language, the Gerudo will never
accept you!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>And we should know! We've spent years
here trying to curry favor with them any
way we could.
They've finally entrusted us with
protecting the <clr:0000>western entrance<clr:ffff> to
Kara Kara Bazaar!
<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0a00>I've lost count of the number of times I've been
swatted with the flat of a guard's spear...<sp:5:1:0>
They mistake me for some lowly opportunist!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>It's only a matter of time until we become
the first men invited into Gerudo Town,
I'm sure of it!
talk0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>That's right, captain! This is nothing
compared to the time those travelers
thought we were a band of criminals!
Or when we were captured and nearly
skewered by the guards!

Or when we finagled our way into
Gerudo Town and got thrown in <clr:0000>jail<clr:ffff>!
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Young man! As the captain of the caravan
squad, allow me to thank you once again
for rescuing Ponthos!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>However...
talk0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Just when we were getting on their good
side, we messed up our one job. They'll
never trust us with guard duty again!
For anyone else, this would spell disaster
for a plan to officially do business with
the Gerudo...
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But the Voe Caravan Squad doesn't know
the meaning of "give up"!
talk0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:QuestionAngry_01>V-very true, Robsten. Our spirit is
truly indomitable.

Though now that you've brought up all
those traumatic memories, I'm feeling a
bit more...domitable than I was earlier.
talk0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Now that the sand shroud cleared up,
I think we'll head to Gerudo Town to
negotiate with them directly!
talk0037:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Once this sand shroud clears up, I think
we'll head to Gerudo Town to negotiate
with them directly!
near0000: I got sand in my eye!
talk0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We were fired from guard duty for
whatever reason...

Which puts a damper on the Voe Caravan
Squad's plans to become the first men
officially accepted by the Gerudo.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But we don't have it in us to give up now!
talk0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Gerudo Town is located straight out of
this gate. It's a town made by Gerudo, for
Gerudo... Which means it's full of Gerudo!
And to us...


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00><sp:0:2:2:7d00>That means it's a utopia!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
